relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Annual Take Back the Night Event/ Walk.

Go out in downtown Hartford or West Hartford! The school is within walking distance of West hartford center / Blue Back Square, home to a ton of cute little restaurants, coffee shops, stores, and a Whole Foods.
Bon Appetit provides the food at the college, and they always have vegetarian/vegan and organic, sustainable options.
I didn't live there, but I certainly enjoyed the food and all the lounges. Rooms weren't too bad either, and new suites had just been built when I graduated.
Known for their high standards, so be prepared!

Join and keep up to date on SPEC, they plan everything fun! And if you are a nursing major - utilize absoluteyl every resource offered. Free tutoring, mentorship, job fairs, resume writing workshops and more. And if you plan to live on campus, I believe they still offer the chance for new students to spend an overnight weekend in the dorms.

Saint Joe's has an awesome nursing program. The class sizes were small, each professor had an idea of how I was doing in other courses and even the Dean knew my name and how I was doing! I was amazed at how personal and empowering my experience was at this small Women's college.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students This is a really great college that will prepare you for the work world more than other colleges. There is some work involved though but as long as you go to class and do you assignments you should be fine. Bang for the buck This school is really expensive. Almost forty thousand dollars a year. But they really help with financial aid and the average person pays half that price. I paid $1500 out of pocket for my first semester so there financial aid is definitely helpful. Am enjoying being here I really enjoy this college. It is an all female college though. I have no problem with it. If you have a problem with it go somewhere else. There is a lot to do during the week. A lot of SPEC (Students Programming and Events Council) activities such as Spa Day, bingo, concerts, craft nights and comedians all for free. The weekends are really quiet her but perfect for homework and during the weekends you have to be willing to make your own fun. Am learning a lot You definitely learn a lot. This is a small school, and for the most part, the professors here
